tool.name: ARIBA run
tool.command:
ariba run
--nucmer_min_id $adv_nucmer.nucmer_min_id --nucmer_min_len $adv_nucmer.nucmer_min_len --nucmer_breaklen $adv_nucmer.nucmer_breaklen
--assembly_cov $adv_assembly.assembly_cov --min_scaff_depth $adv_assembly.min_scaff_depth
#if str($adv_assembly.adv_assembler.assembler) == "spades" --spades_mode $adv_assembly.adv_assembler.spades_mode #if str($adv_assembly.adv_assembler.assembler) != "none" --spades_options $adv_assembly.adv_assembler.spades_options #end if #end if
--threads $adv_other.threads --assembled_threshold $adv_other.assembled_threshold --gene_nt_extend $adv_other.gene_nt_extend --unique_threshold $adv_other.unique_threshold
$adv_other.force $adv_other.noclean $adv_other.verbose
'$ariba_databases.fields.path'
#if str($library.lib_type) == "paired" '$library.R1' '$library.R2' #else if str($library.lib_type) == "collection" '$library.input1.forward' '$library.input1.reverse' #end if
out

param.name: lib_type
param.label: Input reads type or collection
param.help: Select 'paired end' for a single library or 'collection' for a paired end collection

param.name: R1
param.label: Forward reads (R1)
param.help: The file of forward reads in FASTQ format

param.name: R2
param.label: Reverse reads (R2)
param.help: The file of reverse reads in FASTQ format

param.name: input1
param.label: Paired collection
param.help: See help section for an explanation of dataset collections

param.name: spades_mode
param.label: Spades assembler mode
param.help: SPAdes assembler mode either use default WGS mode, Single Cell mode (sc) or RNA mode (rna). Use SC or RNA mode if your input is from a viral sequencing with very uneven and deep coverage. Set assembly_cov to some high value if using SC or RNA mode

param.name: spades_options
param.label: Extra options to pass to Spades assembler
param.help: Sensible default options will be picked based on spades_mode argument. Anything set here will replace the defaults completely

param.name: assembly_cov
param.label: Assembly coverage
param.help: Target read coverage when sampling reads for assembly. The reads are randomly downsampled to the given coverage for assembly. If this option is more than the actual read coverage, then all reads are used for assembly. (Default: 50)

param.name: min_scaff_depth
param.label: Min scaffold depth
param.help: Minimum number of read pairs needed as evidence for scaffold link between two contigs. (Default: 10)

param.name: nucmer_breaklen
param.label: Value to use for -breaklen when running nucmer
param.help: Value to use for -breaklen when running nucmer. (Default: 200)

param.name: threads
param.label: Number of threads
param.help: Experimental. Number of threads. Will run clusters in parallel, but not minimap. (Default: 1)

param.name: assembled_threshold
param.label: Assembly threshold
param.help: If proportion of gene assembled (regardless of into how many contigs) is at least this value then the flag gene_assembled is set. (Default: 0.95)

param.name: gene_nt_extend
param.label: Max number of nucleotides to extend ends of gene matches to look for start/stop codons
param.help: Max number of nucleotides to extend ends of gene matches to look for start/stop codons. (Default: 30)

param.name: unique_threshold
param.label: Proportion of bases to set unique assembled contig
param.help: If proportion of bases in gene assembled more than once is smaller than this value, then the flag unique_contig is set. (Default: 0.03)

param.name: force
param.label: Overwrite output directory, if it already exists
param.help: Overwrite output directory, if it already exists (default: ON)

param.name: noclean
param.label: Do not clean up intermediate files
param.help: Do not clean up intermediate files (default: OFF)

data.name: assembled_genes
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: gzipped FASTA file of assembled gene sequences

data.name: assembled_seqs
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: gzipped FASTA file of assembled sequences

data.name: assemblies
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: gzipped FASTA file of the assemblies

data.name: log_cluster
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Log for the progress of each cluster

tool.help:
**Usage**: ariba run [options] <prepareref_dir><reads1.fq><reads2.fq><outdir>
Runs the local assembly pipeline. Input is dir made by prepareref, and paired reads
